sentence.Network_en: Campaign strategists are calling the plan a clever political gambit.

sentence.Network_en: He sees the proposal as more of a diplomatic gambit than a serious defense proposal.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他看来，与其说这是一项精心筹划的国防动议，倒不如说是外交上的一着妙棋。

sentence.Network_en: His favourite opening gambit is: "You are so beautiful, will you be my next wife?"
sentence.Network_cn: 他最喜欢的开场白是：“你可真是个美人儿啊，能做我的下一任妻子吗？”

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: originally gambett, from Italian gambetto, literally 'tripping up', from gamba 'leg'

encyclopedia.content: gambit是为了帮助分析者和设计者建立并网格化计算流体力学（CFD）模型和其它科学应用而设计的一个软件包。此外，gambit也是一部电影的名字。

entry.tran: （为取得优势而采取的）行动，精心策划的一着，布局
entry.def: A gambit is an action or set of actions, which you carry out in order to try to gain an advantage in a situation or game.

example.ex: He sees the proposal as more of a diplomatic gambit than a serious defense proposal...
example.tran: 在他看来，与其说这是一项精心筹划的国防动议，倒不如说是外交上的一着妙棋。

example.ex: Campaign strategists are calling the plan a clever political gambit.
example.tran: 竞选策划人士认为该计划是一着巧妙的政治棋。

entry.def: A gambit is a remark which you make to someone in order to start or continue a conversation with them.

example.ex: His favourite opening gambit is: 'You are so beautiful, will you be my next wife?'...
example.tran: 他最喜欢的开场白是：“你可真是个美人儿啊，能做我的下一任妻子吗？”

example.ex: Bernard made no response to Tom's conversational gambits.
example.tran: 伯纳德没有接汤姆的话茬儿。

means.word_mean: 1. an opening remark intended to secure an advantage for the speaker
2. a maneuver in a game or conversation
3. a chess move early in the game in which the player sacrifices minor pieces in order to obtain an advantageous position
